channel.title: Wiki Technical
channel.description: Discussion about the scripts that run the site.

item.title: Text colour
item.author: invalid@example.com (dub)
item.dc:creator: dub
item.content:encoded:
Hi, I was told to post this here.


I use white text on my PC. Works fine for most things.
I have a problem viewing things on the unreal wiki though.
Seems for it's pages, it specifies a background colour, but uses the clients PC's default colour, for the text... which for me is white, so I can't read most text on that site because of the light background.

Would it be possible to set the text as black, or another dark colour in the css?
Seems a bit strange to use the default...

Text colour

item.title: Wiki Quote box CSS interpreted weirdly in IE.
item.author: invalid@example.com (JohnnySix)
item.dc:creator: JohnnySix
item.content:encoded:
If you're using the default CSS and IE, you can see the quoteobx as a big column of words :

http://wiki.beyondunreal.com/wiki/Wiki_Markup


Instead of looking like :
You can put quoted text in a neat box.
All Wiki formats apply there.
Click to expand...
It goes:

You
can
put
quoted
text
in
a
neat
box.

All
Wiki
formats
apply
there.
Click to expand...

item.title: Wookee Download
item.author: invalid@example.com (Veregon)
item.dc:creator: Veregon
item.content:encoded: Can we get links to the latest version and documentation of Wookee? Any of the thread links in the Wiki point to unrelated threads now.

item.title: Offline Wiki
item.author: invalid@example.com (Csimbi)
item.dc:creator: Csimbi
item.content:encoded:
Went for the weekend to my gf where there is no internet so I downloaded the Offline package and took it with me on my laptop.
I was very unhappy to see that the searching does not work. What's up with that? Only a bug, or it's not meant to be working?

item.title: Spell checker
item.author: invalid@example.com (Gehn)
item.dc:creator: Gehn
item.content:encoded: Is it possible to add a spell or grammer checker to the wiki when you edit things? Don't know how versitle it is but if that does not work maybe something to search for certian words through different sections of the wiki.
